description: Students study French language and Québec culture through an immersion experience that includes
home stays with local French-speaking families in Québec City and Montreal. Second-year French
grammar and writing and speaking skills are integrated into the reading and discussion of texts
focusing on the experiences and identities of immigrants to Québec and their descendants, as well
as how immigration is shaping the linguistic and cultural identity of the broader Québec
population. Taught in French. Offered periodically during January term. Apply through Smith Center
for Global Engagement. Prerequisites: FREN 231, placement in FREN 232, or by permission of
fullname: Immigration and Identity in Québec (study abroad)
